If you cannot upgrade your PHP version y: If you cannot upgrade your PHP version yourself, you can send an email to your host. We have %1$sexamples here%2$s. If they don't want to upgrade your PHP version, we would suggest you switch hosts. Have a look at one of our recommended %3$sWordPress hosting partners%4$s, they've all been vetted by our Yoast support team and provide all the features a modern host should provide.

If you cannot upgrade your PHP version yourself, you can send an email to your host. We have %1$sexamples here%2$s. If they don't want to upgrade your PHP version, we would suggest you switch hosts. Have a look at one of the recommended %3$sWordPress hosting partners%4$s.
You should update your PHP version to ei: You should update your PHP version to either 5.6 or to 7.0 or 7.1. On a normal WordPress site, switching to PHP 5.6 should never cause issues. We would however actually recommend you switch to PHP7. There are some plugins that are not ready for PHP7 though, so do some testing first. We have an article on how to test whether that's an option for you %1$shere%2$s. PHP7 is much faster than PHP 5.6. It's also the only PHP version still in active development and therefore the better option for your site in the long run.
To which version should I update?: To which version should I update?
Hosts have the ability to update your PH: Hosts have the ability to update your PHP version, but sometimes they don't dare to do that because they're afraid they'll break your site.
Hey, we've noticed that you're running a: Hey, we've noticed that you're running an outdated version of PHP. PHP is the programming language that WordPress and Yoast SEO are built on. The version that is currently used for your site is no longer supported. Newer versions of PHP are both faster and more secure. In fact, your version of PHP no longer receives security updates, which is why we're sending you to this notice.
Your site could be faster and more secur: Your site could be faster and more secure with a newer PHP version.
Go Premium and our experts will be there: Go Premium and our experts will be there for you to answer any questions you might have about the setup and use of the plugin.

Replaced with the post/page excerpt (or: Replaced with the post/page excerpt (or auto-generated if it does not exist)
Replaced with the title of the parent pa: Replaced with the title of the parent page of the current page
Replaced with the title of the post/page: Replaced with the title of the post/page
Replaced with the date of the post/page: Replaced with the date of the post/page
You cannot overrule a WPSEO standard var: You cannot overrule a WPSEO standard variable replacement by registering a variable with the same name. Use the "wpseo_replacements" filter instead to adjust the replacement value.
A replacement variable with the same nam: A replacement variable with the same name has already been registered. Try making your variable name unique.
A replacement variable can not start wit: A replacement variable can not start with "%%cf_" or "%%ct_" as these are reserved for the WPSEO standard variable variables for custom fields and custom taxonomies. Try making your variable name unique.
A replacement variable can only contain: A replacement variable can only contain alphanumeric characters, an underscore or a dash. Try renaming your variable.
Admin only notice: this page doesn't sho: Admin only notice: this page doesn't show a meta description because it doesn't have one, either write it for this page specifically or go into the SEO -> Titles menu and set up a template.
Meta keywords to use for Author page: Meta keywords to use for Author page
Meta description to use for Author page: Meta description to use for Author page
Title to use for Author page: Title to use for Author page
Delete the old data after import? (recom: Delete the old data after import? (recommended)
If you've used another SEO plugin, try t: If you've used another SEO plugin, try the %1$sSEO Data Transporter%2$s plugin to move your data into this plugin, it rocks!
No doubt you've used an SEO plugin befor: No doubt you've used an SEO plugin before if this site isn't new. Let's make it easy on you, you can import the data below. If you want, you can import first, check if it was imported correctly, and then import & delete. No duplicate data will be imported.
Export your %1$s settings here, to impor: Export your %1$s settings here, to import them again later or to import them on another site.
Import settings by locating <em>settings: Import settings by locating settings.zip and clicking "Import settings"
The old data of the imported plugin was: The old data of the imported plugin was deleted successfully.
If you had a .htaccess file and it was e: If you had a .htaccess file and it was editable, you could edit it from here.
If your .htaccess were writable, you cou: If your .htaccess were writable, you could edit it from here.

If your robots.txt were writable, you co: If your robots.txt were writable, you could edit it from here.

You don't have a robots.txt file, create: You don't have a robots.txt file, create one here:

You cannot create a robots.txt file.
A link to your site, with your site's na: A link to your site, with your site's name and description as anchor text.
A link to your site, with your site's name as anchor text.
A link to the post, with the title as an: A link to the post, with the title as anchor text.
A link to the archive for the post autho: A link to the archive for the post author, with the author's name as anchor text.
You can use the following variables with: You can use the following variables within the content, they will be replaced by the value on the right.
Content to put after each post in the fe: Content to put after each post in the feed
Content to put before each post in the f: Content to put before each post in the feed
This feature is used to automatically ad: This feature is used to automatically add content to your RSS, more specifically, it's meant to add links back to your blog and your blog posts, so dumb scrapers will automatically add these links too, helping search engines identify you as the original source of the content.
You might have extra variables you want: You might have extra variables you want to prevent from cleaning out, add them here, comma separated.
Prevent cleaning out Google Analytics Ca: Prevent cleaning out Google Analytics Campaign & Google AdWords Parameters.
If you use Google Analytics campaign par: If you use Google Analytics campaign parameters starting with %s, check this box. However, you're advised not to use these. Instead, use the version with a hash.
Prevent cleaning out Google Site Search: Prevent cleaning out Google Site Search URLs.
Google Site Search URLs look weird, and: Google Site Search URLs look weird, and ugly, but if you're using Google Site Search, you probably do not want them cleaned out.
Redirect ugly URLs to clean permalinks. (Not recommended in many cases!)
People make mistakes in their links towa: People make mistakes in their links towards you sometimes, or unwanted parameters are added to the end of your URLs, this allows you to redirect them all away. Please note that while this is a feature that is actively maintained, it is known to break several plugins, and should for that reason be the first feature you disable when you encounter issues after installing this plugin.
Enforce a trailing slash on all category: Enforce a trailing slash on all category and tag URLs
If you choose a permalink for your posts: If you choose a permalink for your posts with %1$s, or anything else but a %2$s at the end, this will force WordPress to add a trailing slash to non-post pages nonetheless.
This prevents threaded replies from work: This prevents threaded replies from working when the user has JavaScript disabled, but on a large site can mean a huge improvement in crawl efficiency for search engines when you have a lot of comments.
This helps you to create cleaner URLs by: This helps you to create cleaner URLs by automatically removing the stopwords from them.
Redirect attachment URLs to parent post: Redirect attachment URLs to parent post URL.
Attachments to posts are stored in the d: Attachments to posts are stored in the database as posts, this means they're accessible under their own URLs if you do not redirect them, enabling this will redirect them to the post they were attached to.
Usage of this breadcrumbs feature is exp: Usage of this breadcrumbs feature is explained in %1$sour knowledge-base article on breadcrumbs implementation%2$s.
How to insert breadcrumbs in your theme: How to insert breadcrumbs in your theme
Post type archive to show in breadcrumbs: Post type archive to show in breadcrumbs for taxonomies
Taxonomy to show in breadcrumbs for post: Taxonomy to show in breadcrumbs for post types
Below are your published posts&#8217; SE: Below are your published posts’ SEO scores. Now is as good a time as any to start improving some of your posts!

While most of the development team is at: While most of the development team is at %1$sYoast%2$s in the Netherlands, %3$s is created by a worldwide team.
You can exclude posts from the sitemap b: You can exclude posts from the sitemap by entering a comma separated string with the Post ID's. The format will become something like: %1$s.
Please enter the maximum number of entri: Please enter the maximum number of entries per sitemap page (defaults to %s, you might want to lower this to prevent memory issues on some installs):
Save your settings to activate your XML: Save your settings to activate your XML Sitemap.
You do <strong>not</strong> need to gene: You do not need to generate the XML sitemap, nor will it take up time to generate after publishing a post.
You can find your XML Sitemap here: %1$s: You can find your XML Sitemap here: %1$sXML Sitemap%2$s
%1$s comes with some very powerful built: %1$s comes with some very powerful built-in tools:
This tool allows you to quickly change i: This tool allows you to quickly change important files for your SEO, like your robots.txt and, if you have one, your .htaccess file.
Import settings from other SEO plugins a: Import settings from other SEO plugins and export your settings for re-use on (another) blog.
This tool allows you to quickly change t: This tool allows you to quickly change titles and descriptions of your posts and pages without having to go into the editor for each page.
If you have a Google+ page for your busi: If you have a Google+ page for your business, add that URL here and link it on your Google+ page's about page.
To %1$sconfirm your site with Pinterest%: To %1$sconfirm your site with Pinterest%2$s, add the meta tag here:
Pinterest uses Open Graph metadata just: Pinterest uses Open Graph metadata just like Facebook, so be sure to keep the Open Graph checkbox on the Facebook tab checked if you want to optimise your site for Pinterest.
The default card type to use: The default card type to use
Add Twitter card meta data to your site': Add Twitter card meta data to your site's %s section.
This image is used if the post/page bein: This image is used if the post/page being shared does not contain any images.
These are the title, description and ima: These are the title, description and image used in the Open Graph meta tags on the front page of your site.
Add Open Graph meta data to your site's: Add Open Graph meta data to your site's %s section, Facebook and other social networks use this data when your pages are shared.
Using this form you can reset a site to: Using this form you can reset a site to the default SEO settings.
Privacy sensitive (FB admins and such),: Privacy sensitive (FB admins and such), theme specific (title rewrite) and a few very site specific settings will not be imported to new blogs.
Enter the %1$sSite ID%2$s for the site w: Enter the %1$sSite ID%2$s for the site whose settings you want to use as default for all sites that are added to your network. Leave empty for none (i.e. the normal plugin defaults will be used).
Choose the site whose settings you want: Choose the site whose settings you want to use as default for all sites that are added to your network. If you choose 'None', the normal plugin defaults will be used.
New sites in the network inherit their S: New sites in the network inherit their SEO settings from this site
Who should have access to the %1$s setti: Who should have access to the %1$s settings
I don't know why you'd want to use meta: I don\'t know why you\'d want to use meta keywords, but if you want to, enable this.
If you want to prevent /page/2/ and furt: If you want to prevent /page/2/ and further of any archive to show up in the search results, set this to "noindex".
These pages will be %s by default, so th: These pages will be %s by default, so they will never show up in search results.
Date-based archives could in some cases: Date-based archives could in some cases also be seen as duplicate content.
If this is the case on your site, you ca: If this is the case on your site, you can choose to either disable it (which makes it redirect to the homepage), or to add %s to it so it doesn't show up in the search results.
If you're running a one author blog, the: If you're running a one author blog, the author archive will be exactly the same as your homepage. This is what's called a %1$sduplicate content problem%2$s.
Title: Title
Note: instead of templates these are the: Note: instead of templates these are the actual titles and meta descriptions for these custom post type archive pages.
You can determine the title and descript: You can determine the title and description for the blog page by %1$sediting the blog page itself »%2$s
You can determine the title and description for the front page by %1$sediting the front page itself »%2$s
Symbols are shown in the size they'll ap: Symbols are shown in the size they'll appear in the search results.
Choose the symbol to use as your title s: Choose the symbol to use as your title separator. This will display, for instance, between your post title and site name.
%1$s has auto-detected whether it needs: %1$s has auto-detected whether it needs to force rewrite the titles for your pages, if you think it's wrong and you know what you're doing, you can change the setting here.
This is where you would enter the licens: This is where you would enter the licence keys for one of our premium plugins, should you activate one.
Seamlessly integrate WooCommerce with %1: Seamlessly integrate WooCommerce with %1$s and get extra features!
Rank better locally and in Google Maps,: Rank better locally and in Google Maps, without breaking a sweat!
Are you in Google News? Increase your tr: Are you in Google News? Increase your traffic from Google News by optimising for it!
Optimize your videos to show them off in: Optimise your videos to show them off in search results and get more clicks!
The premium version of %1$s with more fe: The premium version of %1$s with more features & support.
You can use the boxes below to verify wi: You can use the boxes below to verify with the different Webmaster Tools, if your site is already verified, you can just forget about these. Enter the verify meta values for:
Choose whether you're a company or perso: Choose whether you're a company or person
This data is shown as metadata in your s: This data is shown as metadata in your site. It is intended to appear in Google's Knowledge Graph. You can be either a company, or a person, choose either:
Google shows your website's name in the: Google shows your website's name in the search results, we will default to your site name but you can adapt it here. You can also provide an alternate website name you want Google to consider.
Are you sure you want to reset your SEO: Are you sure you want to reset your SEO settings?
If you want to restore a site to the def: If you want to restore a site to the default %s settings, press this button.
You do not have your postname in the URL: You do not have your postname in the URL of your posts and pages, it is highly recommended that you do. Consider setting your permalink structure to /%postname%/.
To be able to create a redirect and fix: To be able to create a redirect and fix this issue, you need %1$s. You can buy the plugin, including one year support and updates, on %2$s.
Errors that only occurred when your site: Errors that only occurred when your site was crawled by Googlebot for feature phones (errors didn't appear for desktop).
Errors that occurred only when your site: Errors that occurred only when your site was crawled by Googlebot-Mobile (errors didn't appear for desktop).
Errors that occurred when your site was: Errors that occurred when your site was crawled by Googlebot.
The issues have been successfully reload: The issues have been successfully reloaded!
The %1$s data has been removed. You will: The %1$s data has been removed. You will have to reauthenticate if you want to retrieve the data again.
Don't miss your crawl errors: %1$sconnec: Don't miss your crawl errors: %1$sconnect with Google Search Console here%2$s.
%1$s detected you’re using a version of: %1$s detected you’re using a version of %2$s which is not compatible with %1$s. Please update %2$s to the latest version to use this feature.
Yoast plugins share some code between th: Yoast plugins share some code between them to make your site faster. As a result of that, we need all Yoast plugins to be up to date. We've detected this isn't the case, so please update the Yoast plugins that aren't up to date yet.
The target URL doesn't exist, but your s: The target URL doesn't exist, but your server is not returning a 404 (file not found) error.
Request timed out or site is blocking Go: Request timed out or site is blocking Google.
Googlebot could access your site, but ce: Googlebot could access your site, but certain URLs are blocked for Googlebot in your %1$s file. This block could either be for all Googlebots or even specifically for Googlebot-mobile.
Google was unable to crawl this URL due: Google was unable to crawl this URL due to an undetermined issue.
URL points to a non-existent page.
Server requires authentication or is blo: Server requires authentication or is blocking Googlebot from accessing the site.
The %1$s plugin might cause issues when: The %1$s plugin(s) might cause issues when used in conjunction with %2$s.
This taxonomy follows the indexation rul: This taxonomy follows the indexation rules set under Metas and Titles, you can override it here.
The Breadcrumbs Title is used in the bre: The Breadcrumbs Title is used in the breadcrumbs where this taxonomy appears.
The canonical link is shown on the archi: The canonical link is shown on the archive page for this term.
Meta keywords used on the archive page f: Meta keywords used on the archive page for this term.
If you don't know where to find the need: If you don't know where to find the needed ID, see %1$sthis knowledge base article%2$s.
To be able to access %1$sFacebook Insigh: To be able to access %1$sFacebook Insights%2$s, you need to add a user here. The name is used for reference only, the ID is used for verification.
More info can be found %1$son our knowle: More info can be found %1$son our knowledge base%2$s.
To be able to access %1$sFacebook Insigh: To be able to access %1$sFacebook Insights%2$s for your site, you need to specify a Facebook Admin. This can be a user. If you have an app for your site, you could use that as well.
This Facebook user has already been adde: This Facebook user has already been added as an admin.
Your input contains invalid characters. Please make sure both fields are filled in correctly.
Please make sure both fields are filled.
Both %1$s and %2$s can create XML sitema: Both %1$s and %2$s can create XML sitemaps. Having two XML sitemaps is not beneficial for search engines, yet might slow down your site.
Both %1$s and %2$s create OpenGraph outp: Both %1$s and %2$s create OpenGraph output, which might make Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn and other social networks use the wrong texts and images when your pages are being shared.
The recommended image size for %1$s is %: The recommended image size for %1$s is %2$s pixels.
If you want to override the image used o: If you want to override the image used on %s for this post, upload / choose an image or add the URL here.
If you don't want to use the meta descri: If you don't want to use the meta description for sharing the post on %s but want another description there, write it here.
If you don't want to use the post title: If you don't want to use the post title for sharing the post on %s but instead want another title there, write it here.
Try to make shorter sentences, using les: Try to make shorter sentences, using less difficult words to improve readability.
Try to make shorter sentences to improve: Try to make shorter sentences to improve readability.
The copy scores %1$s in the %2$s test, w: The copy scores %1$s in the %2$s test, which is considered %3$s to read. %4$s
The focus keyword appears in the first p: The focus keyword appears in the first paragraph of the copy.
The focus keyword doesn't appear in the: The focus keyword doesn't appear in the first paragraph of the copy. Make sure the topic is clear immediately.
The keyword density is %1$s, which is gr: The keyword density is %1$s, which is great; the focus keyword was found %2$d times.
The keyword density is %1$s, which is ov: The keyword density is %1$s, which is over the advised %3$s maximum; the focus keyword was found %2$d times.
A meta description has been specified, b: A meta description has been specified, but it does not contain the focus keyword.
No meta description has been specified. Search engines will display copy from the page instead.
The meta description is under %1$d chara: The meta description is under %1$d characters long. However, up to %2$d characters are available.
You have not used the focus keyword in a: You have not used the focus keyword in any subheading (such as an H2) in your copy.
The focus keyword appears in %2$d (out o: The focus keyword appears in %2$d (out of %1$d) subheadings in the copy. While not a major ranking factor, this is beneficial.
The images on this page are missing alt: The images on this page are missing alt attributes.
No links appear in this page, consider a: No links appear in this page, consider adding some as appropriate.
This page has %1$s nofollowed link(s) an: This page has %1$s nofollowed link(s) and %2$s normal outbound link(s).
This page has %1$s outbound link(s), all: This page has %1$s outbound link(s), all nofollowed.
You're linking to another page with the: You're linking to another page with the focus keyword you want this page to rank for. Consider changing that if you truly want this page to rank.
No images appear in this page, consider: No images appear in this page, consider adding some as appropriate.
The SEO title contains the focus keyword: The SEO title contains the focus keyword, but it does not appear at the beginning; try and move it to the beginning.
The SEO title contains the focus keyword, at the beginning which is considered to improve rankings.
The slug for this page is a bit long, co: The slug for this page is a bit long, consider shortening it.
The focus keyword does not appear in the: The focus keyword does not appear in the URL for this page. If you decide to rename the URL be sure to check the old URL 301 redirects to the new one!
You've used this focus keyword %1$s%2$d: You've used this focus keyword %1$s%2$d times before%3$s, it's probably a good idea to read %4$sthis post on cornerstone content%5$s and improve your keyword strategy.
You've used this focus keyword %1$sonce: You've used this focus keyword %1$sonce before%2$s, be sure to make very clear which URL on your site is the most important for this keyword.
You've never used this focus keyword bef: You've never used this focus keyword before, very good.
No focus keyword was set for this page. If you do not set a focus keyword, no score can be calculated.
SEO issue: The featured image should be: SEO issue: The featured image should be at least 200 by 200 pixels to be picked up by Facebook and other social media sites.
The URL that this page should redirect t: The URL that this page should redirect to.
The canonical URL that this page should: The canonical URL that this page should point to, leave empty to default to permalink. %1$sCross domain canonical%2$s supported too.
